column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////On to the food.  We tried two dishes
column2: each of which was better in theory than in execution.  The first was the soft-shell crab courtbouillon ($14)
column5: pickled green beans and a seafood stock.  The soft-shell crab was excellent
column6: but the stock was mostly salty and lacked the complexity of a deep
column7: dark roux you would expect to find in NOLA.  The dumplings
column9: lacked flavor.  The second was the fried oysters with kimchi and blue cheese ($11).  This dish had good flavors
column10: but lacked balance with the briny
column12: funky and tangy all angling for the limelight.  Mostly
column14: with too many competing flavors and too much funk.
